item.title: YAPC::Asia 2008
item.description: Just in case you come to this site by looking for YAPC::Asia 2008, here is the link.

item.title: Now it's time for Video!
item.description:
2 weeks since we made audio recordings available as a Podcast. Now it's time for Video!

All video files are available on i-revo site (as WMV streaming) and Google Video (as Flash/DivX/MP4) and actually integrated with our Sessions details page. You can find the session you'd like to watch again, or didn't attend to during the conference from the timetable and watch videos inline, using Google Video embeded flash player.

We created Videocast feed for MP4 files as well, so you can download movie files and syncronize them to mobile devices like iPod or PSP. Just drop the link to iTunes, Democracy or whatever your favorite media player.

Tons of thanks to i-revo for their great work on ripping and encoding movie files.

Enjoy!

item.title: Audio recordings available for downloads!
item.description:
Podcast feed for the audio recordings at YAPC::Asia 2007 is now ready! Audio files are ripped and encoded as 128kbps mp3 files so they're iPod-ready out of the box. The feed also contains Creative Commons license as item metadata.

The feed is now imported on Odeo as well so you can listen to the recordings just on your favorite browsers without actually downloading the files.

Enjoy the recordings with Slides from the talks. We're currently working on the video recordings as well, which will be available on i-revo site and Google Video.

Thanks to Tsuda Hall staff and folks from i-revo for recording and ripping audio files!

item.title: How to get to the venue
item.description:
The nearest station to the venue Tsuda Hall is either JR Sendagaya station (千駄ヶ谷) or Subway Oedo-sen Kokuristu Kyogijo Station (大江戸線 国立競技場).

Oedo-sen would be handy if you come from stations like Roppongi, Shiodome or Shimbashi. JR would be useful if you're from Tokyo, Shinjuku or other JR stations.

item.title: 1st day: Registration Opens 9:00 AM
item.description:
Time is flying so fast. Now it's less than one day to the conference!

On the 1st day April 4th, we'll open the venue registration on 9:00AM. The first welcome session starts on 9:30 so let's get it real quick. All you need is a ticket purchased from Lawson. If you paid via PayPal, bring the copy of the receipt online. If you pay at the venue, just say your name and pay 4500 JPY there.

See you soon!

item.title: Wiki auth unlocked till 4/5
item.description:
Since some people have been complaining that the TypeKey auth is one of the big barriers for them to edit YAPC::Asia Wiki, so today I made the TypeKey auth as optional. Anynone can now update any page without authentication. (If you want to, you can still login to TypeKey to claim your identity)

It'll be enabled back once the conference is over, but for now, edit away!

item.title: Lightning Talks accepted
item.description:
We got 8 Lightning Talks proposals and they all looked good and are now accepted. See LightningTalks wiki page for the details.

Since there are a couple of slots available, we are extending the deadline for a few days. If you have something in your mind to talk about in 5 minutes, submit your proposal now.

item.title: RSVP required for Conference Party
item.description:
As last year, we're organizing the big conference party in the evening of April 4th, the 1st day of the conference.

Thanks to our sponsors, the food there are FREE and all we need from you is a fee for drinks, which is 1500 Yen. Due to the capacity limitation of the restaurant, we need to call RSVPs for the party. If you're interested, sign up using the web form.

(The speakers and guests are already counted and are free to attend. No need to sign-up!)

The party wil be held April 4th, 7:30 pm at ジョン万次郎 アトレ信濃町店 (John Manjiro, Shinano-cho). You need to pay the fee in the YAPC::Asia registration, not in the restaurant.

item.title: Call For Lightning Talks
item.description:
The call for Lightning Talks for YAPC::Asia 2007 is now open. The Lightning Talks will be held on April 5th, right before the final keynote. We want 11 talks of five minutes each to fill 60 minutes session.

Submit your proposal today using the web form. The deadline for submissions is: March 26th, 2007 23:59 JST (+0900)

item.title: Contribute to the Wiki
item.description:
We have a Wiki site for YAPC::Asia 2007 and there we update lots of useful information about the conference.

If you're going to participate in the conference, Sign up on the Attendees page and add your blog to Planet blog aggregator.

Oh, by the way, the 350 tickets have been sold out and we're now officially closing the registration. See you in Tokyo in a few weeks!

item.title: Recap of YAPC::Asia 2006
item.description:
Now it's less than a month to YAPC::Asia 2007, I guess it's time to revisit the last year's excitement.

We re-imported the audio files on Odeo. It has Podcast feeds and flash based audio player so that you can listen to the session on your favorite web browser.

The video files are on Archive.org and I found that recently they added a new beta flash player feature, which also allows you to watch videos without actually downloading the whole content.

Slides for the talks are available on the Wiki page.

We're working hard to make sure that we can distribute audio/video files this year as well, sometime after the conference. But note that it doesn't mean you don't need to come to the conference venue. Nothing is compared to the experience of being in the venue, talking face-to-face with folks from everywhere Japan and all over the world.

item.title: Registration closing soon
item.description:
Now we sold 300 tickets for domestic attendees and will sell extra 50 tickets by increasing the # of seats this weekend. For international attendees we're still accepting the registration via the web form, but we'll close the registration soon after the extra tickets being sold out, maybe in 2 weeks or so.

If you haven't done, go register the conference now.

UPDATE: We're going to close the registration on March 15th 23:59, Japanese standard time.

item.title: Sessions and Timetable are out
item.description:
Sessions along with Timetable and Speakers profile for YAPC::Asia 2007 are now published.

We publish iCal files for sessions (Kudos to Taichi Kaminogoya for his MT-fu) as well, so that you can subscribe to the schedule using iCal, Sunbird, 30boxes or Google Calendar.

You might notice that some talks are marked as TBD and some speakers' proflie are empty. We're working on updating the data and I hope it will be completed anytime soon.

item.title: Registration Opens
item.description:
We're happy to announce that the registratin for YAPC::Asia 2007 has now opened! Use our web-based registration form (shibuya.pm.org site) to register yourself and pay the conference fee using PayPal to get the 500 JPY off.

If you consider visiting to Tokyo for this YAPC but are still looking for the accommodation, go check out the recommended hotels near the venue.

(Note: This registration form is only for international attendees and people having difficulties buying tickets online. Japanese attendees should buy tickets from Lawson Ticket)

We're looking forward to seeing you in Tokyo!
